title: Andrew Yang
added: He was indorsed by Rep. [[Ritchie Torres]].

title: Andrew Yang
deleted: Andrew Yang's campaign manager, [[Sasha Ahuja]], has been a longtime progressive activist who has ties to controversial Palestinian-rights fighter [[Linda Sarsour]]. Their association has been highlighted on social media frequently. On March 8, 2017, both were arrested during a protest outside [[Trump International Hotel and Tower (New York City)|Trump International Hotel & Tower]] near [[Columbus Circle]]. Sarsour and her Women’s March are also associated with [[Nation of Islam]] leader [[Louis Farrakhan]]. In the past, she has also publicly praised [[Palestinians|Palestinian]] terrorist [[Rasmea Odeh]], who had been convicted for participating in the bombing of a Jerusalem supermarket which killed two people.

[[Linda Sarsour|Sarsour]] has often praised the benefits of [[Sharia|Sharia Law]] and supports the [[Boycott, Divestment and Sanctions|Boycott Divestment and Sanctions]] movement. In contrast, Yang has tried to court [[Jews|Jewish]] voters. He is in favor of [[Israel]] and against [[Boycott, Divestment and Sanctions|BDS]], and supports more autonomy among the city’s religious [[Yeshiva]] schools. On his campaign, Yang named David Schwartz, a district leader in [[Brooklyn]], his “Jewish Community Outreach Director.”<ref>{{Cite web|last=Levine|first=Jon|date=2021-02-13|title=Andrew Yang’s mayoral campaign manager has close ties to Linda Sarsour|url=https://nypost.com/2021/02/13/andrew-yang-campaign-manager-has-close-ties-to-linda-sarsour/|access-date=2021-02-13|website=New York Post|language=en-US}}</ref>

title: Andrew Yang
deleted: Yang came to the aid of a journalist who was being assaulted by a deranged attacker with a metal pole on the Staten Island Ferry on February 26 2021. Yang stepped in between the crazed assailant and the victim, allowing the victim a chance to get away and call police. https://nypost.com/2021/02/26/andrew-yang-rushes-to-help-photographer-during-assault-on-si-ferry/
